But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. # LegalZoom.com Inc. (LZ) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 11, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $6.72 (Yahoo Finance, as of market close Oct 11, 2024)  
**Market Capitalization:** $1.28 billion (Yahoo Finance, as of Oct 11, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $6.14 - $15.15  

## Company Overview (High-Level Summary)
LegalZoom.com Inc. (LZ) is a leading online platform for legal services, empowering small businesses, entrepreneurs, and individuals to access affordable, on-demand legal solutions without traditional attorney costs. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Glendale, California, the company offers a subscription-based model alongside one-time services, streamlining processes like business formation (LLCs, corporations), estate planning (wills, trusts), intellectual property (trademarks), family law (divorces), and compliance (annual reports). LZ operates in the $200+ billion U.S. legal services market, targeting underserved SMBs and consumers who avoid high lawyer fees (average $300+/hour). Its tech-driven platform uses automation, AI, and attorney networks for 99% of services self-serve, with 15,000+ attorneys available for consultations. As of Q2 2024, LZ had 2.1 million subscribers (up 13% YoY), serving over 5 million customers historically. Revenue mix: ~71% subscriptions (recurring), 29% transactional. The company went public in 2021 via SPAC (Thoma Bravo sponsor) and has pivoted to subscription growth amid post-pandemic normalization. LZ's mission democratizes legal access, with strong brand recognition (top-of-mind for online business formation per surveys) and sticky economics (LTV:CAC >3x). Challenges include macroeconomic sensitivity and competition, but tailwinds from SMB digital adoption position it for mid-teens revenue growth. (Word count: 218)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Aug 1, 2024):** Revenue $192.6M (+5% YoY); Subscription revenue $137.4M (+13% YoY); Net income $11.5M (vs. loss prior year); Adjusted EBITDA $39.3M (margin 20.4%); EPS $0.10 (Seeking Alpha transcript, company IR).
- **Q3 2024 Guidance (Aug 1, 2024):** Revenue $179-182M; Adjusted EBITDA $30-32M.
- **New Subscription Launch (Jul 2024):** "LegalZoom Edge" bundle – unlimited estate planning consultations + document updates for $24.99/mo (company press release).
- **AI Integration (Sep 2024):** Rolled out LZ AI Assistant for document drafting/review in beta (Seeking Alpha discussions).
- **Stock Buyback:** $100M program authorized Jun 2024; $20M repurchased YTD (Q2 call).
- **Insider Buying:** CEO Daniel Wernikoff bought 50K shares @ $7.50 (Sep 2024, SEC filings).

## Growth Strategy
- **Subscription-First Shift:** Target 20%+ sub revenue CAGR through upselling bundles (e.g., Business + Compliance + Estate); ARPU up 5% YoY to $66 in Q2 2024.
- **Product Expansion:** AI tools, vertical-specific plans (e.g., real estate agents, gig workers).
- **Marketing Efficiency:** CAC down 10% YoY via SEO/organic; partnerships for acquisition.
- **International?** Limited; focus U.S. but eyeing Canada/Mexico pilots (Q2 call).
- **M&A Pipeline:** Opportunistic tuck-ins in legal tech (CFO hinted Q2 call).

## Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Subscriber growth slowed to 9% YoY Q2 (macro headwinds on formations); High churn risk in economic downturns (unemployment up). | Strong balance sheet ($280M cash, no debt); 85% gross margins on subs; Loyal base (2.1M subs). |
| **Sector (Legal Tech)** | Intense competition eroding pricing; Regulatory scrutiny on non-lawyer practice (ABA rules); Recession sensitivity (business starts down 10% YoY per Census). | SMB boom (30M U.S. SMBs underserved); Digital shift (80% consumers prefer online per Deloitte); AI disruption lowering costs. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Business Formation:** LLCs, Corps ($0 + state fees; 1M+ formed).
- **Compliance:** Annual reports, EINs, BOI filings (new post-2024 CTA).
- **Estate Planning:** Wills, trusts, POA ($99-$599).
- **IP/Family:** Trademarks ($599), divorces ($499+).
- **Subscriptions:** LZ Advantage (business), Legacy (estate) – $199-$399/yr.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **LZ Edge (Jul 2024):** All-in-one sub with attorney access.
- **AI Assistant (Sep 2024 beta):** Draft/review tools; full launch Q4 2024.
- **BOI Compliance Tool (Jan 2024):** For 2024 Corporate Transparency Act.
- **Gig Economy Plan (Q4 2024 planned):** Contracts/tax for freelancers (Q2 call).

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current Market Share:** ~25-30% of U.S. online legal document market (~$5B total; LZ ~$700M rev run-rate); #1 in business formations (50%+ per SimilarWeb traffic data, 2024).
- **Forecast:** Modest gain to 28-35% by 2026 via subs/AI; risk of flat/decline if recession deepens (analyst consensus: 10-15% rev CAGR, Barclays Oct 2024 note).

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric | LZ | Rocket Lawyer | Clerky | Traditional Lawyers |
|--------|----|---------------|--------|---------------------|
| **Subscribers** | 2.1M | ~1M (est.) | <0.5M | N/A |
| **Rev (2023)** | $665M | ~$200M (priv.) | ~$50M | $200B+ sector |
| **Sub % Rev** | 71% | 60% | 40% | 0% |
| **Strength** | Brand/scale | Attorney network | Startup focus | Expertise |
| **Weakness** | Growth slowdown | Higher pricing | Niche | Costly/slow |
| **Valuation (EV/Rev)** | 1.8x | N/A (priv.) | N/A | N/A |

(Sources: Company filings, PitchBook 2024, Seeking Alpha.)

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships:** Intuit (QuickBooks integration, 2023 renewal); Walmart (in-store kiosks pilot, 2024); Microsoft (Azure AI, Jun 2024).
- **M&A:** Acquired Earth Class Mail (2023, $100M for mail digitization); No major 2024 deals.
- **Current Major Clients:** SMBs (e.g., Shopify merchants via integrations); Enterprise: Referral deals with banks/CPAs.
- **Potential Clients:** Gig platforms (Uber/Doordash contracts in discussion, Q2 call); Fintechs for embedded legal.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Management:** CEO Wernikoff (ex-Thoma Bravo) subscription expert; High insider ownership (15%).
- **ESG:** Strong on access (DEI hiring); Carbon neutral pledge (2024).
- **Sentiment:** Mixed – Reddit/StockTwits bearish on growth (down 50% YTD); Analysts: 7 Buys/4 Holds (avg PT $11, Yahoo Oct 2024).
- **Risks:** Macro (rates), litigation (class actions on upsells, ongoing).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 7/10 (Hold-Buy tilt). Solid fundamentals, sub moat, AI upside offset macro risks; undervalued vs. peers (SaaS avg 5x sales).
- **Fair Value Estimate:** $12.50/share (85% upside). DCF-based (15% CAGR to 2027, 12x 2026 EV/EBITDA terminal; moderate risk assumes 10% rev growth, 25% EBITDA margin). Targets strong growth portfolio. (Consensus PT $11.30, Barclays/BofA Oct 2024 notes.)
